title.narrative: STRATEGY FOR ACCES TO BASIC EDUCATION

description.narrative: By 2018, Access to basic education for girls, adolescents and indigenous children is increased including actions on school readiness, which contributes to Children With Disabilities, Early Childhood Development, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2018, 100 per cent girls/boys of primary school and 70% girls/boys of 1st cycle of secondary school, particularly the most vulnerable, achieve quality and inclusive education, and 100% girls/boys and adolescents out of formal school benefit from alternative education.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2018, Access to basic education for girls, adolescents and indigenous children is increased including actions on school readiness

description.narrative: The most vulnerable and disadvantaged girls and boys in development context, in particular hearing-impaired and indigenous children, have access to primary schools, Observe, Reflect Act (ORA) schools or specialized schools to improve school completion rate. | Status:Met | As-of Date:04/02/2020

title.narrative: Service Delivery - Out of school children in the reporting year who participated in early learning, primary or secondary education through UNICEF supported programmes
Education systems are implementing a minimum package of interventions to promote learning outcomes including early learning
